name: Mireford Estuary
economy_niches: reed-weaving and brackish-peat charcoal for ritual uses
culture_adjustments: intensified pilot rites tied to channel memory and tide-reading
harbor-clans exercise stronger local governance than inland offices
daily life prioritizes Sea-Tide offerings over formal ancestor ceremonies
contracts adapted to tidal windows and pilot-fee schedules
seasonal floating hamlets and greater clan mobility
risks: clan feuding over channels and pilot rights
constraints: limited arable land; relies on food imports
ritual reagents partly dependent on scarce imported compounds
navigation auguries require local charts and living pilots
low-tide windows restrict heavy cargo movements
notes: controls key approach channels for State_6 maritime trade
seasonal salt and reagent yields drive ritual and merchant schedules
clan mediators act as primary adjudicators for pilotage disputes
